title: Barba shocks Sharks after signing with French Rugby giants Toulon | League | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 8:38am EST January 31, 2017 8:07am EST Suspended Cronulla Sharks star Ben Barba has hopped codes to sign a deal with Top 14 giants Toulon until the end of the season. Ben Barba, who has signed a deal with Toulon (Getty Images) 
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
Suspended Cronulla Sharks star Ben Barba has hopped codes to sign a deal with Top 14 giants Toulon until the end of the season. 
MORE: Pearce missing as Aubusson leads Roosters in Auckland | Cowboys out to win it with stacked Nines squad | 
Barba was one of the heroes in the Sharks' maiden NRL premiership was released by the club in November after he tested positive for cocaine and was slapped with a 12-match ban. 
The Sharks announced last month that they had re-signed Barba for the upcoming season, but that deal is still pending approval from NRL. 
In the meantime, Barba will play in the 15-man format with Toulon - the same club Sonny Bill Williams fled to mid-season in 2008 - on a contract that runs for the remainder of their campaign. 
A Toulon statement read: "The Australian star of rugby league Ben Barba has committed to Rugby Club Toulonnais until the end of this season." 
Barba is set to arrive in Toulon next week and could be in line to play against Lyon in a Top 14 clash on February 18. 
Provided the NRL agrees to register his contract with the Sharks, Barba would be free to return for the Sharks' June 8 clash against grand-final foes Melbourne. 
The Top 14 regular season wraps up on May 4, with the final to be played on June 4. 
Wallabies Matt Giteau, James O'Connor, Drew Mitchel and Liam Gill all currently play for Toulon.
